meanings.definition: A person who bucks or resists authority or tradition.
meanings.sent1: The teacher had to deal with a group of buckers who refused to follow the rules.
meanings.sent2: The buckers in the town council always questioned the decisions made by the mayor.
meanings.sent3: The buckers at the meeting wore shirts with rebellious slogans.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the chief of the buckers, always challenging the status quo.
meanings.sent5: The buckers painted graffiti on the walls to protest against the new law.

meanings.definition: A device used for bucking or splitting logs.
meanings.sent1: Dad used the buckers to split the firewood for the winter.
meanings.sent2: The old buckers in the shed needed some repairs before they could be used again.
meanings.sent3: The buckers made log splitting look like a piece of cake.
meanings.sent4: The sharp blade of the buckers sliced through the thick logs effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: Using the buckers was much easier than trying to split the logs by hand.

meanings.definition: A type of pickup used in electric guitars to convert string vibrations into electrical signals.
meanings.sent1: The guitarist installed new buckers in his guitar for a better sound.
meanings.sent2: The buckers in the electric guitar enhanced the music during the concert.
meanings.sent3: The buckers hummed softly as the guitarist strummed the strings.
meanings.sent4: The buckers transformed the vibrations into powerful electric signals.
meanings.sent5: With the new buckers, the guitar produced a rich and clear tone.
